intro: Rosa agrestis var. pubescens, commonly known as the rough dog玫瑰, is a shrub-like species native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "pubescens." The plant produces fragrant, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens in temperate climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its sturdy growth habit and seasonal floral display.
